events.message: The policyholder reported a serious car collision that occurred on the morning of May 1st, resulting in significant front-end damage to the vehicle.
The claim was reviewed and categorised as an Auto Accident case given the keywords and reported incident details.
A claims agent was assigned to manage the auto accident claim in order to handle communications and further investigation.
An acknowledgment email was sent to the customer confirming receipt of the car accident claim and providing next steps.
The claims agent requested the customer to submit photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and repair estimates.
Customer uploaded all requested documents including accident photos, police report, and an authorized mechanic’s repair quote.
The internal investigation team began reviewing the evidence and statements related to the vehicle collision claim.
Investigation completed confirming the claim validity with no discrepancies found in the police report or customer statements.
A settlement offer covering the repair costs and rental vehicle expense was proposed to the claimant for review and approval.
The customer responded positively, expressing satisfaction with the proposed settlement amount and the smooth handling of the claim.
The claim was officially approved by the underwriting department, enabling the insurer to proceed with issuing payment.
Insurance payment for the repair and associated costs was issued to the claimant’s designated bank account without delay.
After all financial transactions were completed, the auto accident claim was formally closed and archived in the system.
The claim record was archived for long-term storage in compliance with regulatory requirements and company policy.
